question: Can you provide the syllabus for Computer Science course at ISET Sfax?
answer: Detailed course info available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/formation/informatique. Please refer to the updated syllabus from September 2023. For more info, email informatique@isetsf.rnu.tn or call +216-74-431-425.

question: Where can I find the Engineering program curriculum?
answer: Engineering curricula are available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/formation/genie-civil. The program includes 180 ECTS credits over 3 years. Contact dept-genie@isetsf.rnu.tn for specific questions.

question: What are the prerequisites for Business Administration courses?
answer: Prerequisites for Business Administration are listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/formation/gestion. A minimum GPA of 12/20 in related subjects is required. Contact economie-gestion@isetsf.rnu.tn for details.

question: How do I register for the upcoming semester?
answer: Register online at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite before August 30th. For assistance, contact scolarite@isetsf.rnu.tn or call +216-74-431-426.

question: What's the deadline for summer course registration?
answer: Summer course registration closes on May 15th. Register at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite/inscription-cours-ete. Late registrations incur a 50 TND fee.

question: Can I register for courses after the official deadline?
answer: Late registration is possible up to 10 days after the deadline with a 75 TND late fee. Submit your request at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite/inscription-tardive with proper justification.

question: What is the current tuition fee structure?
answer: Undergraduate tuition is 1,800 TND per year, while graduate programs cost 2,500 TND annually. Details at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite/frais. Payment plans available through finance@isetsf.rnu.tn.

question: Are there merit-based scholarships available?
answer: Merit scholarships cover 25-100% of tuition based on academic performance. Applications open from June 1-30 at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/vie-universitaire/bourses. Minimum GPA of 16/20 required.

question: How can I apply for financial aid?
answer: Financial aid applications are accepted year-round at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/vie-universitaire/aide-financiere. Submit income verification and the completed form to aide@isetsf.rnu.tn.

question: What are the library hours during exam week?
answer: During exam periods, the library extends hours to 8:00-23:00 Monday-Friday and 9:00-20:00 on weekends. Check https://www.iset-sfax.tn/bibliotheque for holiday exceptions.

question: Are there 24-hour computer labs on campus?
answer: The Engineering building houses a 24/7 computer lab accessible with student ID. See https://www.iset-sfax.tn/formation/laboratoires for equipment specifications and usage policies.

question: How do I reserve a study room in the library?
answer: Study rooms can be booked up to 2 weeks in advance through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/bibliotheque/reservation. Reservations are limited to 3 hours per day per student group.

question: What is the minimum passing grade at ISET Sfax?
answer: The passing grade is 10/20 for individual courses and 12/20 for the overall program average. Grading policies at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite/notation.

question: How does ISET Sfax handle plagiarism cases?
answer: Plagiarism results in an automatic 0 for first offenses and possible suspension for repeat incidents. Full academic integrity policy at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite/integrite-academique.

question: What's the attendance policy for laboratories?
answer: Laboratory attendance is mandatory with a maximum 20% absence rate allowed. Missing more requires medical documentation. Details at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite/presence.

question: What student clubs are active this semester?
answer: Currently active clubs include Robotics, Entrepreneurship, Photography, and Cultural Exchange. Join at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/vie-universitaire/clubs or contact clubs@isetsf.rnu.tn.

question: When is the next student cultural festival?
answer: The Annual Cultural Festival runs from March 15-20. Performance registration and schedule available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/vie-universitaire/festival-culturel.

question: Are there sports competitions between departments?
answer: Interdepartmental tournaments in football, handball, and basketball take place each November. Registration and rules at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/vie-universitaire/competitions-sportives.

question: How can I find internship opportunities for IT students?
answer: IT internship listings are posted weekly at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/centre-4c/stages. The Career Center also hosts tech company visits every Tuesday.

question: When is the next campus job fair?
answer: The Spring Job Fair is scheduled for April 12th in the Central Auditorium. Register at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/centre-4c/forum-emploi. Bring 10 printed résumés.

question: Does ISET Sfax help with résumé preparation?
answer: Free résumé reviews are available every Wednesday from 13:00-16:00. Schedule an appointment at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/centre-4c/aide-cv or email carrieres@isetsf.rnu.tn.

question: What visa documentation do international students need?
answer: Required documents include acceptance letter, proof of financial support, and passport valid for 6+ months. Details at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/visa.

question: Are there French language courses for international students?
answer: Complimentary French courses at beginner through advanced levels are offered each semester. Register at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/cours-langue.

question: How can international students find housing?
answer: International student housing options include on-campus dormitories and pre-vetted off-campus accommodations. Applications at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/logement.

question: What's the exact location of ISET Sfax?
answer: ISET Sfax is located at Route de Mahdia Km 2.5 BP 88, Sfax, Tunisia. Campus map available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/plan-campus. GPS coordinates: 34.733°N, 10.766°E.

question: Who should I contact about transfer credits?
answer: For transfer credit evaluation, contact Dr. Amira Cherif at transfer@isetsf.rnu.tn or +216-74-431-429. Required documentation listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/transferts.

question: What's the best way to reach the IT support team?
answer: IT support is available Monday-Friday 8:00-18:00 at helpdesk@isetsf.rnu.tn or +216-74-431-430. Submit support tickets online at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/support-info.

question: How do I reset my student portal password?
answer: Reset your password at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/portail-etudiant/reinitialisation-mot-de-passe. If issues persist, contact helpdesk@isetsf.rnu.tn with your student ID.

question: Where can I access my grade transcripts online?
answer: Official transcripts are available under 'Academic Records' in the student portal. For certified copies, apply at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/portail-etudiant/releves-notes.

question: Can I update my contact information through the student portal?
answer: Update personal information through the 'Profile' section of your portal. Changes to official documents require in-person verification at the Registrar's Office.

question: What online courses are available for distance learning?
answer: Distance learning offerings include 25 fully online courses across all departments. Complete catalog at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/formation/cours-distance with technical requirements.

question: Do you offer night classes for working professionals?
answer: Evening programs run Monday-Thursday from 18:00-21:00 for working professionals. Course schedule and registration at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/formation/cours-soir.

question: Are summer intensive courses available?
answer: Six-week summer intensives are offered in July-August. Course list and compressed syllabus at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/formation/cours-ete. Registration opens May 1st.

question: How do I register for graduation?
answer: Submit graduation applications at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite/diplome three months before completion. Verification fee: 75 TND. Contact diplome@isetsf.rnu.tn.

question: What's the process for course withdrawal?
answer: Course withdrawals are permitted until week 6 with a 'W' grade. After week 6, an 'F' is recorded. Submit requests at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite/retrait-cours.

question: Can I register for courses from other departments?
answer: Interdepartmental registration requires advisor approval. Submit the cross-registration form from https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite/inscription-interdepartementale by the second week of classes.

question: Are installment plans available for tuition payment?
answer: Tuition can be paid in 3 installments (40%-30%-30%) with deadlines in September, December, and March. Set up your plan at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/scolarite/paiement-echelonne.

question: What scholarships are available specifically for female engineering students?
answer: The Women in Engineering scholarship covers 50% of tuition for female students with GPA ≥15/20. Applications at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/vie-universitaire/bourses-femmes-ingenierie.

question: How do I appeal a rejected scholarship application?
answer: Scholarship appeals must be submitted within 14 days of notification. The appeal form is available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/vie-universitaire/appel-bourse with supporting documentation.

question: Where is the engineering materials lab located?
answer: The Engineering Materials Lab is in Building B, Floor 2, Room B-212. Equipment list and reservation system at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/formation/laboratoire-materiaux.

question: How do I access the campus WiFi network?
answer: Connect to 'ISET-Student' network using your student portal credentials. Technical setup guide at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/wifi. Signal available campus-wide.

question: Are there lockers available for students?
answer: Lockers are available in Buildings A, C, and E on first-come basis. Register at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/lockers. Annual fee: 25 TND.

question: What's the policy on makeup exams?
answer: Makeup exams require documented medical or emergency justification submitted within 48 hours. Application form at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/makeup-exams.

question: How many absences are allowed before failing a course?
answer: Students failing to attend 80% of sessions automatically fail. Attendance policy details at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/attendance with exemption criteria.

question: What's the process for appealing a grade?
answer: Grade appeals must be filed within 10 days after posting. The process requires meeting with the instructor first. Form available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/grade-appeals.

question: How can I start a new student club?
answer: New clubs require a minimum of 15 student signatures, faculty advisor, and proposal submission at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/new-club. Review takes 3-4 weeks.

question: What's the schedule for intramural sports?
answer: Intramural schedules are posted monthly at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/intramurals. Soccer, basketball, volleyball, and tennis currently offered weekday evenings.

question: Are there music practice rooms on campus?
answer: Four soundproofed practice rooms are available in the Arts Building. Reserve through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/music-rooms (maximum 2 hours daily).

question: Does ISET Sfax host company recruitment events?
answer: Company presentations occur weekly during recruitment season (October-November and March-April). Schedule at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/company-events.

question: How do I apply for on-campus jobs?
answer: Student employment opportunities are posted at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/campus-jobs. Work limited to 20 hours/week during semesters, 40 hours during breaks.

question: Can the Career Center help with graduate school applications?
answer: Graduate school application assistance includes statement reviews and mock interviews. Book appointments at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/grad-school.

question: What health insurance options exist for international students?
answer: International students must have health coverage. University-partnered plans start at 450 TND annually. Comparison at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/health-insurance.

question: Are there cultural orientation programs for new international students?
answer: A mandatory 3-day orientation for international students runs one week before semester start. Program details at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/orientation.

question: How can international students join the buddy program?
answer: The International Buddy Program pairs new international students with locals. Apply by July 15th for fall semester at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/buddy-program.

question: What are the hours for the Academic Advising Office?
answer: Academic Advising is open Monday-Friday, 8:30-16:30. Schedule appointments at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/advising or drop in during Wednesday open hours (13:00-16:00).

question: How do I reach the campus security office?
answer: Campus Security is available 24/7 at +216-74-431-499 or security@iset-sfax.tn. The main office is located at the main entrance. Emergency procedures at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/security.

question: Where is the Foreign Languages Department located?
answer: The Foreign Languages Department is in Building D, Floor 3. Department chair: Dr. Fatma Kammoun, languages@iset-sfax.tn, +216-74-431-444.

question: How do I submit assignments through the student portal?
answer: Assignment submission is through the 'Coursework' tab. Accepted formats and size limits described at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-portal/assignments. Keep submission confirmations.

question: Can I download course materials for offline access?
answer: Offline access to course materials is available through the mobile app. Download instructions at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-portal/offline-access.

question: When are final grades posted to the student portal?
answer: Final grades appear within 10 days after the exam period ends. Enable grade notification alerts in your profile settings for immediate updates.

question: What's the credit hour requirement for Computer Science degree?
answer: The Computer Science program requires 180 ECTS credits (equivalent to 90 credit hours) over 3 years. Detailed credit distribution at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/computer-science/requirements.

question: Who teaches Artificial Intelligence courses?
answer: AI courses are taught by Dr. Nizar Bouguila and Dr. Sana Fakhfakh. Their office hours and research interests are available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/computer-science/faculty.

question: Can I take programming electives from day one?
answer: First-year students must complete core programming courses before accessing electives. The recommended course sequence is available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/computer-science/sequence.

question: What documents do I need for registration as a returning student?
answer: Returning students need student ID, proof of previous semester completion, and cleared financial status. Complete checklist at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/returning-students.

question: Is there a limit to how many courses I can register for per semester?
answer: Students may register for a maximum of 7 courses (35 ECTS) per semester. Exceptions require academic advisor approval and min. GPA of 15/20. Details: https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/course-load.

question: Can I register for courses at multiple ISET campuses?
answer: Inter-campus registration is possible for up to 2 courses per semester with departmental approval. The application process is outlined at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/inter-campus.

question: What funding options are available for low-income students?
answer: Low-income students may qualify for need-based grants covering 40-100% of tuition. Income verification required. Apply at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/need-based-grants.

question: Is there a discount for paying tuition in full?
answer: Students paying full annual tuition in one installment receive a 5% discount if paid before September 15th. Payment instructions at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/payment-options.

question: What's the refund policy if I withdraw from courses?
answer: Refunds are 80% within first 2 weeks, 50% within weeks 3-4, and 0% thereafter. Medical withdrawals evaluated case-by-case. Policy details: https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/refunds.

question: Where can I find quiet study spaces during peak hours?
answer: Alternative quiet study spaces include Building F mezzanine, Engineering courtyard, and basement level of Building A. Hours and noise policies at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/quiet-spaces.

question: Is there equipment I can borrow for class projects?
answer: The Equipment Loan Center in Building C loans cameras, microphones, testing equipment, and more. Inventory and borrowing limits listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/equipment-loans.

question: Are there shower facilities for students who commute by bicycle?
answer: Shower and changing facilities are available in the Sports Complex and Building D basement. Access with student ID. Opening hours at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/commuter-services.

question: Does ISET Sfax accept transfer credits from foreign universities?
answer: Transfer credits from accredited foreign institutions require official transcript evaluation by ISET's credential service. Evaluation criteria at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/transfer-credits.

question: What accommodations are available for students with disabilities?
answer: Disability accommodations include extended exam time, note-taking assistance, and accessible materials. Register with documentation at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/accessibility.

question: Is there a minimum GPA requirement to graduate with honors?
answer: Honors recognition requires minimum GPA of 16/20 (Honorable), 17/20 (Distinguished), or 18/20 (Highest Distinction). Complete honors criteria at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/honors.

question: How can I volunteer for community service through ISET?
answer: The Community Engagement Office coordinates volunteer opportunities with local organizations. Register for projects at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/community-service.

question: Are there study abroad programs available to ISET students?
answer: ISET has exchange agreements with 12 international partners. Application deadlines and eligibility requirements at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/study-abroad.

question: What mental health resources are available for students?
answer: The Wellness Center provides free counseling services, stress management workshops, and crisis intervention. Schedule appointments at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/wellness.

question: Does the Career Center review cover letters?
answer: Cover letter reviews are available by appointment or during drop-in hours (Mondays 13:00-15:00). Sample successful letters at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/cover-letters.

question: How can I find information about alumni networking events?
answer: Alumni networking events are scheduled quarterly and listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/alumni-networking. Register at least one week in advance.

question: Are there interview preparation resources available?
answer: Interview preparation includes mock interviews, industry-specific question banks, and attire guidelines. Resources at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/interview-prep.

question: What documents are required for residence permit applications?
answer: Residence permit applications require acceptance letter, passport, proof of accommodation, financial guarantee, and medical certificate. Templates at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/residence-permit.

question: Do international students have access to special tutoring services?
answer: International students receive 5 hours of free subject tutoring weekly and ongoing language support. Schedule through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/tutoring.

question: Are there special events for cultural exchange among students?
answer: The International Cultural Series features monthly events showcasing diverse cultures. Schedule and participation information at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/cultural-exchange.

question: How do I report maintenance issues in campus buildings?
answer: Submit maintenance requests through the Facilities Portal at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/maintenance or call the urgent repair line at +216-74-431-450 for emergencies.

question: Who should I contact about lost and found items?
answer: Lost and found is managed by Campus Security. Items are held for 60 days. Check or report lost items at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/lost-found or visit the security office.

question: Where can I find campus shuttle schedules?
answer: Campus shuttle timetables between main campus, residences, and downtown Sfax are posted at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/transportation. Live tracking available on the ISET mobile app.

question: How do I set up notifications for assignment deadlines?
answer: Configure deadline notifications in the Portal Settings under Alerts & Reminders. Instructions at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-portal/notifications.

question: Can I access my class schedule on my phone?
answer: Mobile schedule access is available through the ISET App. Download links and synchronization instructions at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-portal/mobile-access.

question: How do I join virtual classroom sessions through the portal?
answer: Virtual classrooms are accessed through the 'Live Sessions' tab. Technical requirements and troubleshooting guide at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-portal/virtual-classrooms.

question: Where can I find information about accreditation for ISET programs?
answer: All ISET Sfax programs are accredited by the Tunisian Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research. Accreditation certificates at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/accreditation.

question: How many credit hours are required for the Mechanical Engineering degree?
answer: Mechanical Engineering requires 180 ECTS credits including 30 for the graduation project. Detailed requirements at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/mechanical-engineering/credits.

question: Can I access recorded lectures from previous semesters?
answer: Lecture recordings are available for 12 months after course completion. Access archived materials at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/recordings with your student credentials.

question: How do I check if I'm eligible to register for advanced courses?
answer: Prerequisite eligibility checks are automated in the registration system. Manual verification requests can be submitted at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/prerequisites.

question: When does registration open for the spring semester?
answer: Spring registration opens November 15th and closes December 20th. Early registration (for seniors) starts November 10th. Schedule at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/timeline.

question: Is there a waiting list system for full courses?
answer: Waiting lists are available for high-demand courses. Join through the registration portal. Policies and priority rules at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/waiting-lists.

question: How can I apply for an athletic scholarship?
answer: Athletic scholarships cover up to 70% of tuition for national-level competitors. Application requirements and deadlines at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/athletic-scholarships.

question: Are there scholarships for students from rural areas?
answer: The Rural Opportunity Scholarship targets students from designated rural regions. Eligibility map and application at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/rural-scholarships.

question: What payment methods are accepted for tuition?
answer: Tuition payments accepted via bank transfer, online payment, or in-person at the campus cashier. International wire transfer instructions at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/payment-methods.

question: How do I reserve a sports facility for team practice?
answer: Sports facility reservations must be made 48 hours in advance through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/sports-reservations. Student group bookings receive priority on weekdays.

question: Is there a campus cafeteria, and what are its hours?
answer: The main cafeteria operates 7:00-20:00 weekdays and 8:00-14:00 weekends. Menu, pricing, and satellite café locations at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/dining.

question: Where can I print large-format posters for presentations?
answer: The Print Center in Building E handles specialty printing including large-format posters and projects. Pricing and submission guidelines at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/print-center.

question: What is the policy on academic probation?
answer: Academic probation is triggered by semester GPA below 10/20 or cumulative GPA below 12/20. Support resources and restrictions detailed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/probation.

question: How are final exam conflicts handled?
answer: Exam conflicts (three exams in 24 hours) qualify for rescheduling. Submit conflict forms at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/exam-conflicts at least 2 weeks before exam period.

question: What's the policy on extended absences due to illness?
answer: Extended medical absences require documentation from approved healthcare providers. Accommodation process outlined at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/medical-absence.

question: How can I join the student government?
answer: Student government elections occur each October. Nomination forms and campaign guidelines available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/student-government.

question: Are there student discounts for local businesses?
answer: The ISET Student Card provides discounts at 40+ local businesses. Complete discount directory at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/discounts.

question: What student media organizations can I join?
answer: Student media includes campus radio, magazine, and YouTube channel. Application guidelines and production schedules at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/media.

question: How do internships work with the academic calendar?
answer: Internships are integrated with the academic calendar during summer (10 weeks) or academic year (1 day/week). Schedule options at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/internship-timing.

question: Are there industry mentorship programs available?
answer: The Industry Mentorship Program matches students with professionals in their field. Apply by September 15th at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/mentorship.

question: How do I get certified in industry-specific skills?
answer: Industry certification preparation courses are offered through the Career Center. Schedule and exam fees listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/certifications.

question: What banking services are available for international students?
answer: Partner banks offer special accounts for international students with reduced fees. Representatives on campus every Wednesday. Details at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/banking.

question: Are airport pickup services available for new international students?
answer: Complimentary airport pickup available from Sfax-Thyna Airport for new international students. Reservation required 72 hours in advance at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/airport-transfer.

question: How can international students celebrate their national holidays on campus?
answer: International Cultural Celebration Days can be organized through the International Student Office. Planning guidelines at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/cultural-celebrations.

question: What public transportation options are available near campus?
answer: Public buses (#5, #12, #15) stop at the main gate every 15 minutes. Campus-to-downtown shuttle schedule at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/public-transportation.

question: How do I schedule an appointment with the Dean's office?
answer: Dean's Office appointments require advance scheduling through the Administrative Secretariat. Request form available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/dean-appointment.

question: Where are the ATMs located on campus?
answer: ATMs are located at the main entrance, Student Center, and Engineering Building. Service fees and supported banks listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/banking-services.

question: Can I create study groups in the student portal?
answer: Virtual study groups can be created in the 'Collaboration' section. Set privacy settings and invite classmates. Instructions at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-portal/study-groups.

question: How do I request an official enrollment verification letter?
answer: Enrollment verification letters can be requested through the 'Documents' section. Processing takes 2-3 business days. Verification at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-portal/verification-letters.

question: Is there a mobile app for the student portal?
answer: The ISET Mobile App provides portal access including schedules, grades, and announcements. Download for iOS/Android at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-portal/mobile-app.

question: What minors are available with the Computer Science major?
answer: Computer Science students can minor in Data Science, Cybersecurity, or Digital Business. Minor requirements at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/computer-science/minors.

question: How frequently are course offerings updated?
answer: Course catalogs are updated annually with new offerings announced by April 30th. Review upcoming courses at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/upcoming-offerings.

question: What language courses are available beyond French and English?
answer: Language electives include Arabic, German, Spanish, and Italian at beginner through advanced levels. Placement test info at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/languages.

question: Can I change my major after the first year?
answer: Major changes are possible after completing the first year with minimum GPA of 13/20. The application process is detailed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/change-major.

question: What's the process for requesting a leave of absence?
answer: Leave of absence requests must be submitted at least 30 days before the semester start. Form and required documentation at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/leave-absence.

question: Do I need to re-register if I've been away for a semester?
answer: Students returning after an absence must complete the re-enrollment process. Documentation requirements and deadlines at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/re-enrollment.

question: Are there emergency tuition loans available?
answer: Emergency tuition assistance is available for students facing sudden financial hardship. Application criteria at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/emergency-assistance.

question: What corporate scholarships are available for engineering students?
answer: Eight engineering companies offer full scholarships with internship and employment opportunities. Company profiles and selection criteria at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/corporate-scholarships.

question: How do I qualify for a teaching assistant position with tuition benefits?
answer: Teaching assistantships provide 60% tuition reduction for 10 hours/week of service. Application requirements at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/assistantships.

question: Are there bike rental or sharing services on campus?
answer: The campus bike-sharing program offers 50 bicycles at 5 stations. Registration and usage fees at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/bike-sharing.

question: What courses are available in the Mechanical Engineering program?
answer: Explore the Mechanical Engineering curriculum at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/mechanical-engineering. For detailed syllabi, email mech@iset-sfax.tn or call +216-74-431-441.

question: How do I apply for a transfer to ISET Sfax?
answer: Transfer applications are processed through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/admissions/transfers. Submit required documents by June 15th for fall semester consideration. Contact transfers@iset-sfax.tn with questions.

question: Where can I find the lab safety guidelines?
answer: Laboratory safety manuals are available online at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/lab-safety. All students must complete safety training before accessing labs. Download the PDF or request a printed copy at the lab administration office.

question: What scholarships are available for international students?
answer: International student scholarships include the Global Scholar Award and Tunisia-International Exchange Grant. Application details at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/international-scholarships. Deadline: March 30th.

question: How do I access the online student portal?
answer: Access the student portal at https://portal.iset-sfax.tn using your student ID and password. First-time users should follow the activation process described at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-portal/activation.

question: What is the deadline for thesis submissions?
answer: Final thesis submissions are due three weeks before the end of the semester. Upload your document through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/thesis-submission and schedule your defense through your department.

question: Are there internships for Electrical Engineering students?
answer: Electrical Engineering internships are listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/ee-internships. Partner companies include STEG, SIAME, and Sagemcom. For assistance, contact ee-internships@iset-sfax.tn.

question: What are the library's weekend hours?
answer: The library operates from 9:00-20:00 on Saturdays and 9:00-16:00 on Sundays during regular semesters. Holiday and exam period schedules at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/library-hours.

question: How do I request a course withdrawal?
answer: Course withdrawal requests must be submitted through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/course-withdrawal before the 8th week of classes. Include your justification and instructor acknowledgment in the online form.

question: Where is the campus bookstore located?
answer: The campus bookstore is in Building A, Room 102. Hours: 8:30-16:30 Monday-Friday. Textbooks, supplies, and ISET merchandise available. Online ordering at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/bookstore.

question: What is the grading scale for final exams?
answer: ISET Sfax uses a 0-20 grading scale where 10/20 is the minimum passing grade. Grade distributions and scaling policies detailed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/grading-scale.

question: Are there student discounts for public transport?
answer: Students receive a 50% discount on public transportation with a valid ISET ID. Apply for the transport card at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/transport-discounts or at the Student Services office.

question: How do I contact the IT support team?
answer: IT support is available via email at it-support@iset-sfax.tn, by phone at +216-74-431-428, or in person at the IT Help Center in Building C. Hours: 8:00-17:00 weekdays.

question: Can I audit a course without enrolling?
answer: Course auditing requires instructor approval and a reduced fee of 300 TND per course. Application process and restrictions detailed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/audit-courses.

question: What are the cafeteria's payment options?
answer: The cafeteria accepts cash, credit cards, and meal plan cards. Discounted meal plans can be purchased at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/meal-plans. Weekly menus posted online every Sunday.

question: How do I join the robotics club?
answer: The Robotics Club meets Thursdays at 18:00 in Lab B-110. Register through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/robotics-club or attend any meeting to sign up. No experience required.

question: What's the process for deferring a semester?
answer: Semester deferral requests must be submitted at least 30 days before semester start. The application form and required documentation are available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/deferral.

question: Where can I find past exam papers?
answer: Past examination papers are archived in the library's digital repository at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-resources/past-exams. Filter by department, course, and year. Access requires student login.

question: How do I apply for on-campus housing?
answer: On-campus housing applications open April 1st for the following academic year. Apply through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/housing. Priority given to first-year and international students.

question: What are the tuition fees for part-time students?
answer: Part-time students pay 800 TND per course (5 ECTS credits). A detailed breakdown of fees and payment schedule is available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/part-time.

question: Are there tutoring services for math courses?
answer: Free math tutoring is available Monday-Thursday 14:00-18:00 in Room C-205. Schedule appointments through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/tutoring or drop in during open hours.

question: How do I report broken lab equipment?
answer: Report malfunctioning equipment through the maintenance portal at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/maintenance or notify lab staff immediately. Include equipment ID and issue description.

question: What's the policy on late assignment submissions?
answer: Late assignments lose 10% of the maximum grade per day late, with no submissions accepted after 5 days. Detailed policy and exception requests at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/late-submissions.

question: Where can I find the faculty directory?
answer: The complete faculty directory with profiles, office hours, and contact information is available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/about/faculty-directory. Search by name, department, or research area.

question: How do I request an official transcript?
answer: Official transcript requests can be submitted online at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/transcript-requests. Processing takes 3-5 business days. Fee: 25 TND per copy.

question: What workshops are offered this semester?
answer: Professional development workshops this semester include Python Programming, CAD Design, and Project Management. Full schedule and registration at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/workshops.

question: Are there study abroad partnerships?
answer: ISET Sfax maintains exchange agreements with 14 international universities. Program options, eligibility requirements, and application forms at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/study-abroad.

question: How do I reset my campus Wi-Fi password?
answer: Reset your Wi-Fi credentials at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/wifi-reset using your student portal login. For assistance, visit the IT Support desk in Building C with your ID card.

question: What's the dress code for laboratory sessions?
answer: Laboratory sessions require closed-toe shoes, long pants, and lab coats. Safety goggles must be worn when handling chemicals. Complete dress code at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/lab-dress-code.

question: How do I volunteer for campus events?
answer: Event volunteering opportunities are posted at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/volunteer. Submit the online form to indicate your interests and availability. Volunteers receive service hour certificates.

question: What are the course details for Economics at ISET Sfax?
answer: Economics course details are available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/economics. The curriculum includes microeconomics, macroeconomics, and econometrics. Contact econ-dept@iset-sfax.tn for specific questions.

question: What are the registration deadlines for Fall semester?
answer: Fall registration deadline is August 15th. Late registration (with fee) available until August 25th. Complete timetable at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/registration/deadlines.

question: What clubs are available at ISET Sfax?
answer: Student clubs include Debate, Photography, IEEE Student Branch, and Environmental Action. Complete listing and meeting schedules at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/clubs.

question: Are there any upcoming events at ISET Sfax?
answer: Upcoming events calendar available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/events. Features include tech talks, cultural nights, and sports tournaments. Subscribe for email notifications.

question: What internship opportunities are available at ISET Sfax?
answer: Internship opportunities are posted weekly at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/internships. Filter by field, duration, and paid/unpaid. Contact internships@iset-sfax.tn for personalized assistance.

question: How can I attend job fairs organized by ISET Sfax?
answer: Job fairs are held in November and April each year. Register at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/job-fairs at least one week in advance. Bring your CV and student ID for entry.

question: What visa support is provided by ISET Sfax?
answer: Visa support services include documentation assistance and liaison with government offices. International students should contact international@iset-sfax.tn or visit the International Office in Building A.

question: Are there language support services for international students?
answer: Language support includes intensive Arabic and French courses for international students. Register at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/international/language-support. One-on-one tutoring available upon request.

question: How can I contact ISET Sfax via email?
answer: General inquiries can be sent to info@iset-sfax.tn. Department-specific contact information is listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/contact/departments.

question: Where can I update my profile on the student portal?
answer: Profile updates can be made through the 'My Profile' section of the portal. Photo uploads and emergency contact changes require verification. Instructions at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-portal/profile.

question: Can you provide the syllabus for Business course at ISET Sfax?
answer: Business course syllabi are available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/courses/business. Includes course objectives, assessment methods, and required textbooks. For questions, contact business-dept@iset-sfax.tn.

question: What are the approved payment methods for tuition?
answer: Tuition can be paid via bank transfer, credit card (online), or cash (finance office). International wire transfer details and online payment link at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/payment-methods.

question: Is there a student health clinic on campus?
answer: The Student Health Center is located in Building D. Services include basic medical care, vaccinations, and health counseling. Hours and appointment booking at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/health-center.

question: How do I apply for a parking permit?
answer: Parking permits are issued through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/parking. Annual fee: 100 TND. Submit vehicle registration and student ID. Limited spaces available, apply early.

question: How can I run for student government?
answer: Student government election applications open in September. Candidate requirements and campaign guidelines at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/student-government. Submit platform statements by September 15th.

question: What counseling services are available for students?
answer: Counseling services include individual therapy, group sessions, and crisis intervention. Appointments can be scheduled at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/counseling. All services are confidential.

question: How do I find roommates for off-campus housing?
answer: The roommate matching service is available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/roommate-finder. Create a profile with your preferences and browse potential matches. Verification required.

question: Are there family housing options available?
answer: Family housing is limited but available for married students. Application process and eligibility requirements at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/family-housing. Priority deadline: May 1st.

question: What support services exist for students with disabilities?
answer: The Accessibility Office provides accommodations including note-taking assistance, extended exam time, and adaptive technology. Register with documentation at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/accessibility.

question: How do I access the career assessment tools?
answer: Career assessment tools are available through the Career Center portal at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/career-services/assessment. Includes personality inventories, skills assessments, and career matching.

question: What are the options for meal plans on campus?
answer: Meal plan options range from 5 to 21 meals per week. Pricing and registration at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/meal-plans. Special dietary accommodations available upon request.

question: How can I get involved in research as an undergraduate?
answer: Undergraduate research opportunities are listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/undergraduate-research. Application requires faculty sponsor and research proposal. Funding available for selected projects.

question: What printing services are available on campus?
answer: Printing services include black-and-white and color printing, scanning, and binding. Locations and pricing at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/printing. Connect via campus Wi-Fi or USB drive.

question: Where can I report issues of discrimination or harassment?
answer: Report discrimination or harassment incidents to the Ethics Office at ethics@iset-sfax.tn or through the confidential form at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/about/ethics. Anonymous reporting option available.

question: How do I arrange for a campus tour?
answer: Campus tours are scheduled through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/about/campus-tours. Group and individual options available. Specialized department tours require 1-week advance notice.

question: What religious services are available on campus?
answer: Prayer rooms are located in Buildings A and C. Multi-faith calendar and religious accommodation requests at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/religious-services.

question: How can I access psychological services in a crisis?
answer: Crisis psychological support is available 24/7 at +216-74-431-500 or through the urgent help button in the student portal. In-person crisis support at the Wellness Center during business hours.

question: What software is available for student use?
answer: Licensed software includes MATLAB, AutoCAD, Adobe Creative Cloud, and SPSS. Download instructions at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/software. Available for personal and lab computers.

question: How do I subscribe to campus emergency alerts?
answer: Emergency alert subscription is managed through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/safety/alerts. Notifications sent via SMS, email, and app push. Update contact information to ensure delivery.

question: What fitness facilities are available for students?
answer: Fitness facilities include a gymnasium, pool, tennis courts, and weight room. Hours and equipment reservation at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/fitness. Group classes schedule posted monthly.

question: How can I get a student ID card replacement?
answer: ID replacement requests are processed at the Security Office (Building A, Room 101). Fee: 20 TND. Bring identification and complete the form at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/id-replacement.

question: What legal advisory services are available to students?
answer: Free legal consultations available Tuesdays 13:00-16:00. Schedule appointments at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/legal-services. Services include lease reviews, consumer disputes, and immigration matters.

question: How do I apply for graduation?
answer: Graduation applications must be submitted through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/graduation-application at least 3 months before completion. Pay the 75 TND processing fee and verify your requirements with your advisor.

question: What is the policy on double majors?
answer: Double major requirements include minimum 15/20 GPA and completion of 30 additional ECTS credits. Application process and eligibility at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/double-major.

question: Can I take courses at partner universities?
answer: Cross-institutional enrollment is possible with advisor approval. Partner institutions and credit transfer policies listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/cross-enrollment.

question: How do I apply for a teaching assistant position?
answer: Teaching assistant applications require faculty recommendation and 16/20 minimum GPA in the relevant course. Apply at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/teaching-assistants by July 15th.

question: What is the policy on retaking courses to improve grades?
answer: Students may retake up to 5 courses to improve grades. The higher grade is kept in GPA calculations. Registration process at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/grade-improvement.

question: How can I check the status of my degree requirements?
answer: Degree progress is tracked in the 'Degree Audit' section of the student portal. For personalized guidance, schedule an appointment at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/degree-check.

question: What is the policy on incomplete grades?
answer: Incomplete grades must be resolved within 45 days of the following semester. Requirements and extension requests detailed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/incomplete-grades.

question: How do I request a course substitution?
answer: Course substitution petitions require department chair approval. Submit the form available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/substitutions with justification and documentation.

question: What is the academic calendar for the current year?
answer: The full academic calendar with all deadlines, holidays, and exam periods is available at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/calendar. Subscribe for updates and reminders.

question: How can I challenge a prerequisite requirement?
answer: Prerequisite challenge applications must include prior coursework or experience documentation. Submit through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/prerequisite-challenge by registration deadline.

question: What is the policy on academic dismissal?
answer: Academic dismissal occurs after two consecutive semesters on probation. Appeal process and readmission criteria outlined at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/dismissal.

question: How do I petition for a course overload?
answer: Course overload petitions (more than 35 ECTS per semester) require 15/20 minimum GPA and advisor support. Application at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/overload.

question: What is the credit transfer policy for exchange students?
answer: Exchange student credit transfers require pre-approval using the form at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/exchange-credits. Submit course syllabi with your application.

question: How many times can I change my major?
answer: Students are permitted one major change without penalty. Additional changes require dean approval and may extend graduation timeline. Process at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/major-changes.

question: What is the attendance policy for religious holidays?
answer: Religious holiday absences are excused with advance notice. Submit the accommodation form at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/religious-accommodations at least 2 weeks before the absence.

question: How do I request a retroactive withdrawal?
answer: Retroactive withdrawal petitions require substantial documentation of extenuating circumstances. Submit to the Academic Standards Committee via https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/retroactive-withdrawal.

question: What is the final exam schedule?
answer: Final exam schedules are posted 4 weeks before exam period at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/exam-schedule. Check regularly for updates and room assignments.

question: How do I apply for independent study credit?
answer: Independent study applications require faculty sponsor, research proposal, and department approval. Forms and guidelines at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/independent-study.

question: What's the process for declaring a minor?
answer: Minor declarations must be submitted after completing 60 ECTS credits. Choose from 18 available minors at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/academic-policies/minor-declaration.

question: How can I reserve a private room in the library?
answer: Library study rooms can be reserved up to one week in advance for 2-hour blocks. Make bookings at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/library-rooms or at the circulation desk.

question: What computer labs are available for design software?
answer: Specialized design software (Adobe, CAD, 3D modeling) is available in Labs C-301 and D-105. Hours and equipment specifications at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/design-labs.

question: How do I get access to research laboratories?
answer: Research lab access requires safety training completion and faculty authorization. Submit the access request form at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/research-labs.

question: Where can I store my project materials on campus?
answer: Project storage lockers are available in Buildings B and C on a semester basis. Apply at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/project-storage. Limited availability, apply early.

question: How do I report a facilities maintenance issue?
answer: Maintenance issues can be reported through the Facilities Portal at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/maintenance or via the ISET mobile app. Include location and detailed description.

question: What audio/visual equipment can I borrow?
answer: A/V equipment including projectors, cameras, and sound systems can be borrowed from Media Services in Building D. Reservation form at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/av-equipment.

question: Are there charging stations for electric vehicles?
answer: Electric vehicle charging stations are located in Parking Lots A and C. Registration and usage instructions at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/ev-charging. Fee: 2 TND per hour.

question: How do I reserve the conference rooms?
answer: Conference rooms for student organizations can be reserved through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/room-booking. Requests must be submitted at least 48 hours in advance.

question: What recreational facilities are available on weekends?
answer: Weekend recreational facilities include the gymnasium, swimming pool, and tennis courts. Hours and reservation process at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/weekend-recreation.

question: How do I access specialized software in the labs?
answer: Specialized software requires account activation through https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/software-access. Training sessions for complex applications are scheduled monthly.

question: What catering services are available for student events?
answer: Campus catering can be arranged for student events with at least one week's notice. Menus and pricing at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/catering. Discounts for registered organizations.

question: How do I reserve equipment for field research?
answer: Field research equipment reservation requires faculty approval and safety training. Inventory and booking form at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/field-equipment.

question: What are the hours for the campus copy center?
answer: The Copy Center operates Monday-Friday 8:00-18:00 and Saturday 9:00-13:00. Services and pricing listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/copy-center.

question: How do I get after-hours access to buildings?
answer: After-hours building access requires department authorization and security enrollment. Application form at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/after-hours with faculty endorsement.

question: What recycling programs are available on campus?
answer: Campus recycling stations are located in all buildings. Materials accepted and sustainability initiatives described at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/recycling.

question: How do I report safety concerns about campus facilities?
answer: Safety concerns should be reported immediately to campus security at +216-74-431-499 or through the online form at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/safety-concerns.

question: Where can I find vegetarian or halal food options?
answer: Vegetarian and halal options are available at all campus dining locations. Weekly menus and nutrition information at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/dining-options.

question: How do I register as a commuter student?
answer: Commuter student registration provides access to day lockers and lounge facilities. Register at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/commuter-services with proof of residence.

question: What lactation rooms are available on campus?
answer: Private lactation rooms are located in Buildings A, C, and E. Access and amenities information at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/lactation-rooms.

question: How do I get a locker in the fitness center?
answer: Fitness center lockers can be rented by semester or academic year. Apply at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/fitness-lockers. Daily use lockers also available.

question: Where can I practice musical instruments on campus?
answer: Sound-isolated practice rooms are available in the Arts Building. Reservation system and hours at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/facilities/music-practice. Instrument storage available for registered users.

question: What are the qualification criteria for merit scholarships?
answer: Merit scholarship qualification requires minimum 16/20 GPA and full-time enrollment. Additional criteria and application process at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/merit-criteria.

question: How do I apply for hardship-based tuition reduction?
answer: Hardship-based tuition reduction requires documentation of financial circumstances. Application guidelines and required forms at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/hardship-reduction.

question: What scholarships are available for returning adult students?
answer: Adult learner scholarships are available for students over 25 years of age. Eligibility and application details at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/adult-learner-scholarships.

question: How do I appeal a financial aid decision?
answer: Financial aid appeals must be submitted within 10 days of decision notification. Process and documentation requirements at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/aid-appeals.

question: What is the policy on tuition refunds for military deployment?
answer: Military deployment qualifies for 100% tuition refund regardless of timing. Documentation requirements and process at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/military-refunds.

question: How can I apply for research funding as an undergraduate?
answer: Undergraduate research funding applications open each semester. Project proposal guidelines and submission portal at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/research-funding.

question: What external scholarship opportunities are available?
answer: External scholarship database with over 200 opportunities is maintained at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/external-scholarships. Filter by field of study and eligibility criteria.

question: How do I become a scholarship peer mentor?
answer: Scholarship recipients can apply to become peer mentors for incoming scholars. Responsibilities and benefits outlined at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/peer-mentors.

question: What is the policy on scholarship renewal requirements?
answer: Scholarship renewal requires maintaining minimum GPA and enrollment requirements. Criteria varies by scholarship type. Details at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/scholarship-renewal.

question: How do I apply for conference travel funding?
answer: Conference travel funding is available for students presenting research. Application requirements and reimbursement process at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/conference-funding.

question: What academic achievement scholarships are available?
answer: Academic achievement scholarships are awarded based on GPA tiers. Award amounts and qualification levels detailed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/achievement-scholarships.

question: How do cooperative education programs affect tuition?
answer: Co-op program participants pay reduced tuition during work terms. Rate structure and credit requirements at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/co-op-tuition.

question: What scholarship options exist for student athletes?
answer: Athletic scholarships are available in 12 sports based on performance and team needs. Tryout information and coach contacts at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/athletic-awards.

question: How do I apply for emergency financial assistance?
answer: Emergency financial assistance is available for unexpected hardships. Application process and eligibility criteria at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/emergency-assistance.

question: What tuition benefits are available for ISET employees' families?
answer: Employees' dependents receive 50% tuition reduction. Eligibility requirements and application process at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/employee-benefits.

question: How do I qualify for the entrepreneurship scholarship?
answer: Entrepreneurship scholarships require business plan submission and faculty recommendation. Application guidelines at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/entrepreneurship-scholarship.

question: What is the campus policy on scholarship stacking?
answer: Scholarship stacking is limited to 100% of tuition and fees. Prioritization and excess fund allocation policies at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/scholarship-stacking.

question: How do I find work-study positions on campus?
answer: Work-study positions are listed in the employment portal at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/work-study. New openings posted every Monday. Eligibility based on financial aid status.

question: What scholarships are available for graduate students?
answer: Graduate student funding options include teaching assistantships, research grants, and merit scholarships. Complete listing at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/graduate-funding.

question: How do I set up direct deposit for scholarship refunds?
answer: Scholarship refunds can be direct deposited by providing banking information at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/direct-deposit. Processing takes 5-7 business days.

question: What international mobility grants are available?
answer: International mobility grants support study abroad experiences. Funding amounts and application deadlines at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/tuition/mobility-grants.

question: How can I join student government committees?
answer: Student government committee applications are accepted at the beginning of each semester. Committee descriptions and responsibilities at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/committees.

question: What intramural sports are offered in the fall semester?
answer: Fall intramurals include soccer, basketball, volleyball, and tennis. Registration deadlines and league schedules at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/fall-intramurals.

question: How do I start a new student organization?
answer: New student organization applications require 15 member signatures, constitution, and faculty advisor. Guidelines at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/new-organizations.

question: What cultural celebration events are held annually?
answer: Annual cultural celebrations include International Festival, Tunisian Heritage Day, and Regional Cuisine Fair. Event calendar at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/cultural-events.

question: How can I participate in campus leadership development?
answer: Leadership development programs include the Emerging Leaders Institute and Leadership Certificate Program. Application details at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/leadership.

question: What volunteer opportunities are available near campus?
answer: Community volunteer opportunities are coordinated through the Service Center. Current projects and sign-up at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/volunteer-opportunities.

question: How do I join the student newspaper?
answer: The student newspaper accepts new staff each semester. Writing, photography, and editing positions described at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/newspaper.

question: What peer mentoring programs are available for first-year students?
answer: First-year peer mentoring pairs new students with upperclassmen in their field. Program details and mentor application at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/peer-mentoring.

question: How can I get involved in campus sustainability initiatives?
answer: Sustainability initiatives include the Green Campus Committee and Environmental Action Team. Ongoing projects and meetings listed at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/sustainability.

question: What art and creative expression programs are offered?
answer: Creative arts programs include exhibitions, performances, and workshops open to all students. Schedule and participation information at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/arts.

question: How do I register for outdoor adventure trips?
answer: Outdoor adventure trips are scheduled monthly. Registration, equipment requirements, and trip descriptions at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/outdoor-adventures.

question: What gaming and e-sports opportunities exist on campus?
answer: Gaming clubs and e-sports teams meet weekly in the Digital Recreation Center. Tournament schedule and membership information at https://www.iset-sfax.tn/student-life/esports.

question: I'm a new student

question: Je suis un nouvel étudiant

question: Je suis un parent

question: Je suis un chercheur
answer: Bienvenue ! L'ISET Sfax dispose de divers centres de recherche et opportunités de collaboration. question: Je suis un étudiant international
answer: Bienvenue ! L'ISET Sfax accueille les étudiants internationaux. Nous offrons un soutien pour les processus de visa, l'hébergement et l'intégration.
